8/8

That's it! Thanks for reading!

Starting tomorrow, I'm dropping a daily tweet on a new tokenomics insight with the hashtag: #azftokentips

Turn on those ğŸ”” so you don't miss them! ğŸª™

7/8

#7: Read more.

Rather than scrolling through Twitter for hours, take some time to read up on the newest projects or tokens.

Every new whitepaper you read adds to your ability to assess and evaluate the next project. 

You'll start thinking months ahead of the market.

6/8

#6: Understand volatility and that it's near impossible to predict the future.

Projects I consult for often ask me if their tokenomics will make sense in 2025. 

I tell them not even the Fed with teams of Econ PhDs can predict the economy in 6 months, much less in 3 years.

5/8

#5: Calculate utility to completion.

If a token has utility via burning, how much can be burned and for what purpose? Is there a date when the utility is complete?

Rather than being surprised, figure out the how incentives change as tokens get used and burned.

4/8

#4: Figure out the loop holes.

Early on, whales figured out an arbitrage opportunity with $LOOKS and capitalized via wash trading.

If you can figure this out before others, you'll have an arbitrage opportunity.

The market always finds them. Can you find them first?

3/8

#3: Assess backwards from 30 days.

Does the reward system front load a ton of rewards? Does that mean there's a game of chicken for getting out?

Is there hype and attention that will die down?

Who will still be holding after 30 days? Who will be coming in?

2/8

#2: Evaluate with complete objectivity.

The market doesn't care about your bags or your feelings. Smart contracts and whitepapers are the law of the land.

You can come to the tokenomics with a perspective but understand what is fact and what is simply your opinion.

1/8

#1: Read the whitepaper and docs.

I have a feeling 95% of you are holding NFTs/tokens you don't fully understand and only bought in because of Twitter hype.

NFTs and DeFi is like any other form of investment â€” you need to do your research and become informed.

I get tons of DMs asking how I evaluate tokenomics. Here's how. #azftokentips

$X2Y2 Summary
- Only worth claiming if > 1ETH in volume
- ğŸ“‰ whale incentives to generate trading volume on platform
- NFT listing rewards => ğŸ“ˆ listings
- Fair onboarding but no ambassadors to ğŸ“ˆ community trust
- Higher risk/ higher reward token than $LOOKS

15/17

This is a fantastic reward mechanism. If Iâ€™m going to list + sell my NFT, why not get free rewards just to list? 

This solves one side of the market and encourages people to list their NFTs. 

Biggest risk = calculating P. Could invite loopholes to generate $X2Y2.

14/17

2. NFT listing (staking)

Unique to $X2Y2 is the ability to earn $X2Y2 by listing your NFT. 

They calculate rewards with a formula based on how likely your NFT will be sold â€”> the underlying mechanic is yet to be revealed. https://t.co/aGJlhouzrD

13/17

Whatâ€™s the impact of moving rewards from trading to staking?

- No wash trading => ğŸ“‰ WETH rewards
- ğŸ“ˆ $X2Y2 rewards

=> higher risk, higher reward bet 

Rewards mostly in $X2Y2 rather than split with WETH => ROI heavily correlated with $X2Y2 price

12/17

1. $X2Y2 staking

Hereâ€™s a breakdown of $X2Y2 staking emissions. Similar to $LOOKS, holders also get access to WETH market fees.

At the moment, b/c of artificial supply shock, the APR is insanely high â€”> that will drop once more people get access to their $X2Y2. https://t.co/Ab9xziP0To

11/17

Claim #3: No trading rewards, only staking rewards

$LOOKS wash trading created inflated trading volume that benefited stakers with inflated WETH rewards.

$X2Y2 instead only rewards two types of staking: 

1. $X2Y2 staking
2. NFT listing

https://t.co/sLcMx4KjR3

9/17

Strategic investors are not all bad.

Startups take money from @a16z / @sequoia for their network and expertise to grow product and business.

In $LOOKS case, people like @dingalingts were critical in building trust to connect our wallets to a completely new platform.

8/17

Claim #2: No private sale

$LOOKS got a bad rep for giving whales a backroom deal.

$X2Y2 offered a public ILO (initial liquidity offering) where anyone could buy at $0.25 and lock $X2Y2 for 360 days (while still earning rewards). Fair ğŸ‘ 

But AZF, what is the downside?

7/17

1. More traders != more volume

Smaller traders do not own $$$ NFTs => less $ trading volume

2. Fewer "whales"

Capped 1,000 $X2Y2 => fewer incentives to move their entire portfolio into X2Y2 (bigger $LOOKS bag)

No $$$ NFTs listed => no big sales => minimal trading volume

6/17

Assuming conservative prices:

G1 = $30
G2 = $30
Y = $2

X > (30+30)/33.33*2
X > 0.9 ETH

To break even, youâ€™ll want at least 1 ETH of trading volume to even consider claiming $X2Y2. 

$X2Y2 reaches more people than $LOOKS=> Airdrop is more inclusiveğŸ‘

What does this mean?

5/17

For those with < 30 ETH volume, who should consider claiming $X2Y2? Letâ€™s do some math

X = User Volume
Y = $X2Y2 price
G1 = Gas to list NFTs for claiming
G2 = Gas to claim $X2Y2

1000*(X/30)*Y - (G1 + G2) > 0
1000*(X/30)*Y > G1 + G2
X/30 > (G1 + G2)/1000Y
X> (G1+G2)/33.33Y
